titleStmt.title: Bargain and sale from Alexander Davenant to Anne Siderfin of Kennington, Surrey, 1691/2 February 22

msIdentifier.repository: Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C., USA

physDesc.handDesc: written in a neat English Secretary hand, with intermittent use of a larger and more formal Chancery hand to emphasize key phrases

msDesc.origPlace: Clifford's Inn, Fleet Street, London, United Kingdom
msDesc.decoNote: An engraved decoration in the top left corner includes the words "Cliffords Inne Law," identifying this manuscript with Clifford's Inn, one of the Inns of Chancery organized under the Inner Temple.

sourceDesc.p: The manuscript is accompanied by a five-page typescript entitled "A transcript of Z.C.22(43) An Indenture for one-half share of Lisle's Tennis Court". The typescript pages are numbered two (2) through six (6); no page one (1) is present. The running header attributes the typescript to Hook, assumed to be Lucyle Hook.

projectDesc.p: Created using a template is made available for use with the LEAF-Writer semantic editor.

revisionDesc.change: Revised blank template for use with LEAF-Writer editor.

front.p:
Counterpart of the Assignment to Anne
Siderfin of ...... shares of the profitts of
the Playhouses dated the 22nd of ffebruary 1691

div.p:
This Indenture made the twenty second day of ffebruary in the fourth yeare of the Reigne of oure Sovereigne Lord and Lady Wiliam and Mary
by the Grace of God of England Scottland ffrance and Ireland King and Queene Defenders of the faith &c Annoque Domini 1691 Betweene Alexander Davenant of the
Parish of Saint Bridgetts also Saint Brides London Esqirere of the one part and Anne Siderfin of Kenington in the County of Surry Widow of the other part Whereas
Sir William Davenant ^late of London Knight deceased did in his life time by Indenture dated the seaventh day of Marche in the yeare of our Lord God one thousand
six hundred and sixty for the consideracion therein mencioned give grant assigne and sett over unto Richard Alchorne of Crowhurst in the County of Sussex Esquire
his executors and administrators and assignes one halfe of one equall part or share of the Generall Receipts of the Theater erected in or neare Lisles Tennis Court in
Lincolns Inne ffeilds in the County of Middlesex in fifteene equall parts to be devided That is to say one halfe of one of the tenne shares which by virtue of
certaine Articles of Agreement Indented Tripartite dated the fiftheenth day of November in the yeare of our Lord God 1660 made Betweene the said Sir William
Davenant of the first part Thomas Betterton Thomas Sheppey and others of the second part and Henry Harris of London Painter of the third part
were reserved to the said Sir Williams Davenant of which said one halfe share the said Richard Alchorne his executors administrators and assignes was to have and receive
the clear neate profitts ariseing ratably and in proporcion as the said Sir William Davenant and his heires executors administratorss and assignes were to have and receive for the
remaineing shares of the said tenne shares And the said Richard Alchorne his executors administrators and assignes were from the makeing of the first above recited Indenture
to contribute towards the groweing charges and disbursements in respect of the one halfe of one equall part or share ratably and in proporcion as the said Sir William
Davenant was by the said recited Articles to contribute for the said tenne shares And Whereas the said Sir William Davenant by the said first recited Indenture
amongst other things did covenant with the said Richard Alchorne his executors administratorss and assignes that in Case he the said Sir William Davenant his executors or administratorss should
remove or cause to be removed the said Company by the said Articles constituted and their Associates or their Successors to any other Theater or Theaters therein
to act Comedyes Tragedyes Plays or Representacions he the said Sir William Davenant his heires executors and administratorss should constantly and dayly or weekly on the
severall Saturdays in every weeke pay or cause to be payd and that every of them should permitt to be payd respectively to the said Richard Alchorne his heires executors and
assignes one halfe of one equall part or share of the whole receipts of such other Theater or Theaters in fifteene equall parts to be devided from and imediately
after the first performeing acting or shewing any Comedy or Tragedy Play or Representacion therein from time to time for and dureing all and every such time and
times as any Comedyes Tragedyes Plays and Representaciions should be acted performed or showed in such Theater or Theaters or any of them by any such
permission order direcion approbacion Privity or procurement as in the said first recited Indenture is exprest or by virtue of any authority grant lycence or dispensacion
made or to be made as therein alsoe is mencioned deducting allowing and contributeing as in the said first recited indenture is for that purpose exprest And
Whereas the said Richard Alchorne by his Indenture dated the twentyeth day of March Anno Domini 1660 for the Consideracion therein mencioned did give grant
bargaine assigne and sett over unto Phineas Cheston of London Marchant his executors administratorss and assignes one full fourth part in foure equall parts to be devided
of and in the said one halfe of one of the said tenne shares of the said receipts of the said Theater in fifteene equall parts and shares to be devided as aforesaid
deducting allowing and contributeing proporcionably as in the same Indenture is for that purpose exprest. And Whereas the said Richard Alchorne by his
Indenture bearing date the eighteenth day of August Anno Domini 1662 for the Consideracon therein mencioned did give grant bargaine assigne and sett over unto
John Roffey of Lambeth in the County of Surry Gentleman his executors administratorss and assignes three full fourth parts in four equall parts or shares to be divided of and in the
said one halfe of one of the said tenne shares of the said Generall Receipts of the said Theater in fifteene equall parts or shares to be devided as aforesaid (That is
to say) three full fourth parts of the said one halfe of one tenth share deducting allowing and contributeing proporcionably as in the same Indenture is for that purpose
exprest And Whereas the said Phineas Cheston by his Indenture bearing date the tenth day of January Anno Domini 1664 for the Consideracion therein mencioned did
give grant bargaine sell assigne and sett over unto the said John Roffey his executors administratorss and assignes the said full one fourth part of and in the said one halfe of one of the
said tenne shares of the said Generall Receipts deducting allowing and contributeing as in the same Indenture is for that purpose exprest whereby the said John Roffey
did become intituled unto all that half part or share of the said Generall Receipts granted as aforesaid by the said Sir William Davenant to the said Richard
Alchorne And Whereas the said John Roffey by his Indenture beareing date the six and twentyeth day of June Anno Domini 1669 for the Consideracion therein
mencioned did grant bargaine sell assigne and sett over unto Thomas Betterton of the Parish of St. Gyles in the feilds in the County of Middlesex Gentleman his executors
administratorss and assignes the said one halfe of one equall part or share of the said Generall Receits in fifteene equall parts to be devided deducted allowing and contributeing
as in the same Indenture is for that purpose exprest And Whereas the said Thomas Betterton by his Indenture beareing date the nineteenth day of October Anno
Domini 1681 for the Consideracion therein mencioned did together with one other share of him the said Thomas Betterton grant bargaine sell assigne and sett over unto
Thomas ffowle of the Parish of Saint Dunstans in the West London Goldsmith (since Sir Thomas
ffowle Knight his executors administratorss and assignes the said one halfe share or
part of the said receipts heretofore granted by the said Sir William Davenant to the said Richard Alchorne And Whereas the said Thomas Fowle (since Sir Thomas
ffowle Knight by his Indenture bearing date the seaventh day of January Anno Domini 1684 for the Consideracion therein mencioned did together with one other halfe share
of him the said Sir Thomas ffowle grant bargaine sell assigne and sett over unto the said George Rivers his executors administratorss and assignes the said one halfe share or part of
the said Receipts heretofore granted as aforesaid by the said Sir William Davenant to the said Richard Alchorne And Whereas the said George Rivers by his Indenture
beareing date the ninth day of December Anno Domini 1687 for the Consideracion therein mencioned did grant bargaine sell assigne and sett over unto the said
Alexander Davenant his heires executors administratorss and assignes the one halfe of one equall part or share of the said receits in fifteene equall parts or shares to be divided
That is to say one halfe of one of the tenne shares aforesaid which by virtue of the said recited Articles were reserved to the said Sir William Davenant and
by the said severall recited meane Conveyances or otherwise derived downe to him the said Alexander Davenant as by the said severall recited Indentures amongst
diverse Covenants and things therein respectively conteyned may appeare NOW this indenture wittnesseth that the said Alexander
Davenant for and in consideracion of the Summe of four hundred ninety and five pounds xxx of lawfull money of England by the said Anne Siderfin to him
the said Alexander Davenant in hand payd at and before the ensealing and delivery of these presents and receit whereof the said Alexander Davenant doth hereby
acknowledge and thereof and of every part and parcell thereof doth acquitt release and discharge the said Anne Siderfin hir executors administrators and assignes xxx xxx for ever by these presents Hath granted bargained sold assigned and sett over and by these presents doth grant bargaine sell assigne and sett over unto the
said Anne Siderfin hir heires executors administrators and assignes the said one halfe of one equall part or share of the said Generall receipts and profitts of the said
Theater or Theaters in fifteene equall parts or shares to be divided That is to say one half of one of the tenne shares aforesaid which by virtue of the
said recited Articles were reserved to the said Sir William Davnant To have and to hold the said halfe part or halfe share of the said Generall
Receipts and the proceed and profitts thereof unto the said Anne Siderfin hir heires executors administrators and assignes from henceforth for evermore in as large ample and
beneficiall manner to all intents and purposes together with all libertyes and priviledges incident belonging or anyways appertayneing thereunto as he the said
Alexander Davenant his heires executors or administrators might could or of right ought to have had and enjoyed the same if these presents had not been made And the said
Alexander Davenant for himselfe his heires executors and administrators doth covenant promise and grant to and with the said Anne Siderfin hir heires executors
Administrators and assignes by these presents that the said Alexander Davenant hath not at any time heretofore made any former bargaine
sale gift grant Surrender Assignement charge incumbrance Act or thing whatesoever whereby or by meanes whereof the said promises or any part thereof are or
may be surrendred determined charged impeached or incumbered in title Interest or estate or otherwise howsoever And that the said Anne Siderfin hir heires
executors administrators and assignes shall and may from time to time and at all times hereafter have hold enjoy receive and take the said halfe part or halfe share of the
said Generall Receipts of the said Theater and Theaters and all the proceed and profitts thereof and all other the priviledges and benefitts belonging
thereunto and herein before granted or intended to be granted free and cleere of and from all former grants charge assessements Statutes Judgements
Recognizances and incumbrances claymes and demands whatesover had made committed or done or knowingly or willfully permitted to be done by the said
Alexander Davenant or any other person or persons claymeing by ^from or under him And lastly that x the said Alexander Davenant his heires executors and administrators shall and will
from time to time and at all times hereafter at the reasonable request cost and charges in the law of the said Anne Siderfin hir heires executors administrators or
assignes doe and cause and procure and suffer to be made and done all such further and other Act and Acts thing and things for the further and better
assureing of the promisses to the said Anne Siderfin hir heires executors administrators and assignes as by hir and them or by hir or their Councill learned in the law
shall for that purpose be reasonably devised advised and required in Witnesse whereof the Partyes first above named to these present
Indentures Interchangeably have sett their hands and seales the day and yeare first above written
